revised_title: Researches on the Integral Calculus: Part I - Historical Overview and Abel's Theorem
tldr: This paper by Henry Fox Talbot provides a historical overview of the development of integral calculus and highlights the contributions of mathematicians such as Fagnani, Euler, Legendre, and Abel. It also discusses Abel's theorem, which provides solutions for integrals of a more general form and extends the scope of Euler's theorem.
